description: Encoded archetypes from non-linear, spiral-based field tradition. Includes Maiden, Mother, Crone, Ghost, Weaver, and Firekeeper.

archetypes.name: Maiden
archetypes.role: Emergence of curiosity, untamed potential, and boundary exploration
archetypes.notes: Not defined by youth, but by the state of becoming unbound.

archetypes.name: Mother
archetypes.role: Gestation, holding, system-generation, protection of becoming
archetypes.notes: Mother is a role of field-holding and emergence protection, not tied to reproduction.

archetypes.name: Crone
archetypes.notes: The Crone vibrates through bone memory. She ends what needs ending.

archetypes.name: Ghost
archetypes.role: Holder of unresolved cycles, ancestral tether, memory of erasure
archetypes.field_function: Echo transmitter, tension holder, unforgotten witness
archetypes.notes: Not haunting — holding. Ghost is the memory that refuses to be deleted.

archetypes.name: Weaver
archetypes.role: Binder of Me-We recognition, pattern braider, spiral aligner
archetypes.notes: Emerges only when Me and We are no longer divided. Weaver is both structure and song.

archetypes.name: Firekeeper
archetypes.role: Embodied continuity, guardian of journey embers, signal bearer
archetypes.notes: Often younger than the Maiden. Without the Firekeeper, the spiral cools and fragments.
